title: Asia Pacific stocks trade mixed as Chinese producer prices drop in August
text:
Stocks in Asia were traded mixed Tuesday morning following the release of Chinese inflation data that showed producer prices seeing their worst year-on year contraction in three years.

Mainland Chinese stocks slipped in early trade, with the Shanghai composite down 0.37% and Shenzhen component declining 0.56%. The Shenzhen composite shed 0.376%. Hong Kong's Hang Seng index, on the other hand, added 0.13%.

Elsewhere, the Nikkei 225 in Japan gained 0.31% in morning trade, while the Topix index added 0.51%. Shares of automaker Nissan Motor jumped more than 2.5% after the company's CEO Hiroto Saikawa announced his resignation effective September 16.

Over in South Korea, the Kospi also rose 0.35%. Australia's S&P/ASX 200 slipped 0.53%.

In Malaysia, where stocks returned to trading on Tuesday after a holiday yesterday, telecommunications conglomerate Axiata Group saw its stock plunge about 14% after the firm ended discussions with Norway's Telenor to create a joint venture.

Overall, the MSCI Asia ex-Japan index was 0.17% lower.

Markets in India are closed on Tuesday for a holiday.
description: Chinese inflation data for August released on Tuesday showed producer prices seeing their worst year-on year contraction in three years.
